Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 03:37PM Lee_Asbell wrote: I was 36. Did not know I was BRCA1 positive until I was 50. No recurrence. No sign of cancer now, but still about to do a bilateral mastectomy and hysterectomy.
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2012 01:34PM Lee_Asbell wrote: Many people have been in your shoes. Hang in there. No screening modality can catch everything. Better to have a biopsy, know what is going on and move forward, even if it is more hurry up and wait. It took THREE times before I knew for sure I had cancer. Two fine needle biopsies and an excisional biospy. Six months after I had a lumpectomy and node dissection, my mammogram was not normal and I had to have another biopsy, this time a guided core needle biopsy. Everything was fine that time. If your breast tissue is dense, expect that you will be treated with extra scrutiny and remember that is a good thing, even if it is a pain in the butt. Â
Posts.Title: Long journey... guineamom Druanne
